page.title: 19Living in Burford in 1945
page.content: An annualÂ£Pound Day' was held in aid of the Cottage Hospital when pounds of jam etc.were donated.Dr.Eager & Dr.Sharpley served the area.In 1945 Burford had its own police station and magistrates' court.The present primary school took children up to the age of 14,and the Grammar School was in the High Street. Visitors came to Burford and the neighbourhood;some travelling by bicycle.People worked on local farms,shops,laundry and brewery. Some people commuted to Witney and Oxford.Wages were about 8 pounds a week.At the end of the War members of service units and Land Army shared in a Thanksgiving Service.Since 1945 some village schools have closed ;many properties have been bought as weekend cottages.
